unit.label: Act III, Scene III
unit.title: SCENE III. Alexandria. A Room in the Palace.

conventions.dash_policy: classify em/en/hyphen as separate tokens; all dash types normalize to "-"
conventions.bracket_policy: strip underscores and outer brackets from stage spans

spans.text: SCENE III. Alexandria. A Room in the Palace.
Enter Cleopatra, Charmian, Iras and Alexas.
Herod of Jewry dare not look upon you
But when you are well pleased.
I’ll have! But how, when Antony is gone,
Through whom I might command it?—Come thou near.
I looked her in the face, and saw her led
Between her brother and Mark Antony.
Is she as tall as me?
Didst hear her speak? Is she shrill-tongued or low?
Madam, I heard her speak. She is low-voiced.
That’s not so good. He cannot like her long.
I think so, Charmian: dull of tongue and dwarfish!
What majesty is in her gait? Remember,
If e’er thou look’dst on majesty.
Her motion and her station are as one.
She shows a body rather than a life,
I do perceive’t. There’s nothing in her yet.
Guess at her years, I prithee.
And I do think she’s thirty.
Bear’st thou her face in mind? Is’t long or round?
For the most part, too, they are foolish that are so.
As low as she would wish it.
Thou must not take my former sharpness ill.
I will employ thee back again; I find thee
Most fit for business. Go make thee ready;
Indeed, he is so. I repent me much
That so I harried him. Why, methinks, by him,
The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.
Hath he seen majesty? Isis else defend,
I have one thing more to ask him yet, good Charmian.
But ’tis no matter; thou shalt bring him to me
Where I will write. All may be well enough.
